result.execSummary:
All charges against Dayton Patrick Quaerna in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dayton Patrick Quaerna is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:32 PM Defendant Dayton Patrick Quaerna in court appearing by audio.  Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. No attorney wishes to proceed without one, not guilty plea entered by defendant. Remand to branch for scheduling.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:47 PM Defendant Dayton Patrick Quaerna in court phone.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address updated and date of birth verified.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions. No contact directly or indirectly with victims DCQ, DEQ or IPQ, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except for 1 time text to tell wife of no contact conditions and she may contact victim witness office. Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant must sign bond on June 14, 2022 between 12 PM and 1 PM. Court orders bond to be refunded to poster. Adjourned initial appearance June 29, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
